node.title: Body modifier found guilty of female genital mutilation
node.description: Brendan RussellÂ is found guilty of female genital mutilation after a judge rejects his lawyer's argument that laws prohibiting the practice are intended to be limited to children.
node.content: ["A NSW body modifier has been found guilty of female genital mutilation after a judge rejected his lawyer's argument that laws prohibiting the practice were intended to be limited to children.", "Brendan Leigh Russell, 40, pleaded not guilty in the NSW District Court to three charges over procedures he performed on three separate women between 2015 and 2017.", "The most serious charge of manslaughter related to the 2017 death of a woman who had a snowflake-shaped implant placed under the skin of her hand at his Transition tattoo and body modification parlour in Erina Fair shopping centre on the Central Coast.", "Russell also denied intentionally causing grievous bodily harm after a woman who underwent an $800 \"tummy tuck\" in 2016 was left in \"extreme pain\" and required corrective surgery.", "The third charge, female genital mutilation, related to the partial excise of a woman's labia in January 2015.", "This\u00a0procedure was performed with the client's consent, but it was conceded it was not for medical purposes and Russell was not an authorised medical practitioner.", "Russell's lawyers pointed to a High Court decision in arguing that laws prohibiting non-medical female genital alterations were intended to be limited to children or traditional and ritualistic procedures and should not be read \"literally\".", "Judge Helen Syme today said the suggestion that the practice was not illegal because some cosmetic surgeons may perform it for cosmetic purposes only was \"completely unsustainable\".", "She also rejected Russell's lawyers' submission that, by disagreeing with their argument about interpretation, the court would somehow be \"criminalising a woman's access to labiaplasty as a cosmetic procedure\".\u00a0", "\"This court is doing no such thing,\" Judge Syme said.", "The judge, who heard the trial without a jury, is yet to reveal her verdict on the remaining two charges.", "Judge Syme said the trial was not intended to pass judgement on a person's decision to undergo body modifications, nor the reasons behind that decision.", "She said such alterations, when performed by a properly qualified person, are \"apparently not uncommon\".", "The tummy tuck client, a former student nurse who considered Russell family, previously told the court he was \"confident and very convincing\" before her procedure, leading her to believe she was in \"really good hands\".\u00a0", "The client's husband recalled Russell placed his scalpel in her open wound and left it \"sitting in her fatty tissue\" during the procedure.", "The court was shown graphic photographs and videos of Russell removing a strip of skin from her stomach.", "Russell described her bleeding in the days after as normal despite her \"extreme pain\", she said.", "The woman later went to hospital for corrective surgery but did not reveal who performed the initial procedure due to embarrassment.", "The trial heard Russell offered a wide range of modifications including subdermal implants, piercings, earlobe reconstructions, dermal \"anchors\", scarification and genital piercings."]
